comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
@MasterKia Could you please take a look?
Adding something like this:
```adblock
||zarpop.ir^$third-party
```
and maybe `2ad.ir#%#//scriptlet('prevent-window-open')`/`2ad.ir#%#//scriptlet('abort-on-property-write', 'needpop')` should block popups.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: Coalescing rules that work the same.
issue.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

Example: <https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/100000>

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

<!-- Please write a comment here -->

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

### Terms

- [ ] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body: The only private thing may be the email in the git history.

comment.body:
Z tego co pamiętam, to w Operze nie działa filtrowanie HTTPS, przez to na większości stron internetowych część reguł nie jest stosowana.

Niestety nie potrafię odtworzyć tego problemu w Chrome.
Spróbuj proszę zaktualizować filtry, wyczyść dane witryny (ciasteczka oraz pamięć podręczną), a potem sprawdź proszę ponownie, czy problem nadal występuje.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.freshdirect.com/your_account/chef_table.jsp](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.freshdirect.com%2Fyour_account%2Fchef_table.jsp) ### Comment Username: @quaybj > This food ordering site has the option to get weekly discounts. The link to the promotion number and the discounted list does not work with adguard installed on my machines (MAC and PC). I have Chrome, Firefox, and Brave. That particular URL is blocked for all of them. I am using https://dns.adguard-dns.com/dns-query in my router DNS setting. Disabling adguard in the browsers does not work, maybe because it's the router DNS? The picture where the box is seen is from a machine where adguard is not installed at all. > > While making this query, I saw a lot of references to information on the settings for adguard, can you point me to the manual? I don't even know if I am using some of the settings or not, so I could not really answer the questions. ### Screenshots

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://wp.pl](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwp.pl) ### Comment > Strona wp.pl nie wyświetla się poprawnie. Błąd wyświetlania występuje od rubryki Sport (screen). Ustaliłem, że po wyłączeniu "Filtr innych irytujących elementów AdGuard" problem zniknął. issue.title: m.vk.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://m.vk.com/kinomania?from=group](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fm.vk.com%2Fkinomania%3Ffrom%3Dgroup) ### Comment > Суть ситуации: есть необходимость быстрого просмотра пабликов VK в браузере Яндекс без регистрации. При этом хочется убрать рекламу в пабликах, т.к. она не относится к нужному контенту и исключить назойливые плашки о регистрации. Сначала пробовал включить AdGuard в режим VPN, все работает замечательно - рекламы нет, раздражителей нет. Но при этом некоторые приложения на Android телефоне (Сбербанк, Wildberries), даже добавленные в исключения AdGuard, продолжают напоминать про VPN. Это тоже определенный раздражитель. В режиме локального HTTP прокси напоминаний про VPN нет, но "отваливается" DNS фильтр и AdGuard начинает пропускать рекламу и раздражители. Данная проблема присутствует и на других пабликах - "Киномания" просто приведена в качестве иллюстрации. В общем, добиться комфортной работы пока не удалось. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/dTAC2hx.jpg)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/DzZrRjB.jpg)

comment.body:
@slayers85 

I am closing this issue since it's not a filters issue, but please add more information if there's anything new.

Generally speaking, in order to fix this on our side, we need a reliable way to reproduce it by ourselves.
Frankly, LIVE streaming would be rather hard to repro. What about the issue with logging in to `www.tworld.co.kr`, is it still happening with WFP + V3 365?

Also, am I right that in v7.12 disabling WFP driver is a working temporary solution?

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.walmart.com/account/login](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.walmart.com%2Faccount%2Flogin) ### Comment Username: @misc-activities > In the Walmart login page (see 0.png), I entered my email address and clicked on the Continue button. It opened a message box trying to show me a "Press and Hold" type CAPTCHA but the CAPTCHA didn't load. This can be seen in 1.png. So, I clicked on "Try a different method" in the message box. When I did that, it showed me a picture identification type CAPTCHA (see 2.png). When I completed the CAPTCHA verification, instead of asking me for the password, it went back to the page where it was asking for my email address and showed a message saying, "Something went wrong, please try again." This can be seen in 3.png. > > I closed the AdGuard app and tried and I was able to login successfully. I also tried with Stealth Mode disabled but that didn't work. > > I'm having this issue in Safari as well. ### Screenshots

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension

### AdGuard version

4.1.53

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome, Safari, Microsoft Edge

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://instagram.com

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. AdGuard breaks Instagram scrolling; ad removal makes the page jump back to a previous post and you can't scroll past it. Disabling AdGuard fixes the problem.

2. Can't show with screenshot, see attached screen recording

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7212610/226141501-1651b875-7792-45b4-8641-6dc4408308d1.mp4


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
@BlazDT yes still happening with latest filters, traced it to this rule:

`instagram.com#$?#article:-abp-has(> div[style*="display: none !important;"]:only-child) { padding-bottom: 0px !important; border-bottom: none !important; border: none !important; }`
